title: Eliminate a Variable
text: The equations are already in standard form. To get opposite coefficients of $$y$$, multiply the first equation by $$2$$.\n(3*x-y=-7)*2\n$$4x+2y=-6$$
speech: The equations are already in standard form. To get opposite coefficients of  y , multiply the first equation by  2 .\n(3*x-y=-7)*2\n 4 x plus 2 y is equal to negative 6

title: Simplify and Add
speech: Add the two equations.\n 6 x minus 2 y is equal to negative 14 \n 4 x plus 2 y is equal to negative 6

4 x plus 2 y is equal to negative 6

title: Solve for $$x$$
text: $$y$$ will be eliminated and then solve for $$x$$.\n$$10x=-20$$\n$$x=-2$$

title: Substitute and Solve for $$y$$
text:
Substitute $$x=-2$$ into one of the original equations and solve for $$y$$.
$$3\left(-2ight)-y=-7$$
$$-6-y=-7$$
$$y=1$$

title: Solution as Ordered Pair
text: Solution to the system of equations is $$(-2,1)$$.
